casebody.data:
John VERMILLION v. UNITED STATES of America. No. 7562. Circuit Court of Appeals, Sixth Circuit. Dec. 18, 1936. D. G. Boleyn and C. A. Noble, both of Hazard, Ky., Moss Noble, of Jackson, Ky., and Harry N. Smith and W. A. Schuberth, both of Cincinnati, Ohio, for appellant. Mac Swinford, U. S. Atty., of Lexington, Ky.

Before HICKS, SIMONS, and ALLEN, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

It is ordered that the motion of appellee to dismiss appeal be, and the same is, granted and the appeal is hereby dismissed.
